item.title: [SPR-2053] DefaultMessageListenerContainer infinitely fails if JMS configuration is incorrect on WLS
item.description:

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment:
I've reworked DefaultMessageListenerContainer's exception handling for 2.0 RC1. There is an explicit "handleListenerSetupFailure" callback now, a sibling of "handleListenerException" that will be invoked for Session/MessageConsumer failures. The default implementation logs the message and waits for a specified recovery interval (default is 5 sec).

So in your scenario, the log won't get spammed with log messages anymore, but there's still gonna be repeated log messages every couple of seconds - and for each listener thread. I plan to revisit this issue for 2.0 RC2, trying to introduce centralized recovery instead of recovery per listener thread. We should also be able to recover the underlying (shared) JMS Connection if necessary.

Juergen

Centralized Connection recovery is fully implemented now, available from CVS HEAD as well as in the latest nightly snapshots - and in the just-around-the-corner 2.0 RC3.

Juergen
